positive.review:
Hands down THE BEST IDLE EVER!  The more you play it just gets better, from bosses names to item names to the bloody troll challenge, real offline progression, no adds, no forcing you to buy in game currency which you get in game by playing AND its free!
At the start it might seem boring, maybe a little confusing but i promise you it just gets better and better!
The developer is the funniest F@C# with so much little detail it blows over most peoples heads but every little thing just makes it so funny but also rewarding, it makes the grind not really a grind, its so satisfying but makes you crazy at the same time!
If you like idles THIS IS IT! This will be your addiction!
Addicting and incredibly deep. Lovely game to either micromanage actively or let ride idle. Super fun too.

I'm addicted. I don't even know where to begin describing this masterpiece. The only idle game I've ever enjoyed for more than like....a day. Big numbers gong up fast! It's easy, and easy to learn. I honestly am unaware of/confused by a handful of functions in the game myself, but it doesn't impact the gameplay nor how enjoyable it is. 10/10, five golden stars, I am autistic and foaming at the mouth for this game. Even more awesome considering NGU is free

I might not have the hours everyone else has but I can brag that I totally owned "A Small Piece of Fluff". I put game down, came back a few years later and guess what? 

The small Piece of Fluff killed me :( It had I bet been plotting for years....

Played this on other platform (Still do). If you like Idle/incremental games and haven't played this. Quit reading this and try your hand at trying to kill "A Small Piece of Fluff". 

Game is absolutely fantastic.

Tickles my brain in a good way
Play as you want in the very beginning until your first Titan, but then I heavily recommend joining their discord to read what to focus on
Everything is free in the shop for those who can wait and have patience
679h at time of writing

Solid idle / incremental game. It's a slog for 100% achievements if that's all you're after. Playtime is not accurate because most time was spent playing it before it was added to Steam, but I did get 100%.
great game to relax after throwing a fit towards arknights and other gatchas f*cking you over

Really good idle game, heavy on the idle the longer you play. I put this on while I'm at work and check in every so often to reallocate my energy and magic, clear my inventory, etc. Not very many "active" elements other than resource management, but still fun and has draw to it.

legitimately SO fun for people who love "number go up" idle games, and think that menuing is the most fun part. game for meeeeee????
my only gripe is that there are only window sizes, there is no fullscreen option, which is a damn shame. i have pretty bad eyesight and struggle to parse letters sometimes, even with my glasses. an option for accessibility to resize the ui text as larger, or even just a fullscreen option, would make a world of difference for me.
(also, there is no audio or music to it? hope that gets added eventually!)

Not an idle game for the most part. However, it scratches that idle itch during your gaming period. Do not minimize, leave it on in the background and watch your numbers grow =D. 10/10 content overall tbh.
Loving this so far, it's got a lot that certain something.  Seriously liking it, learning a bit more of and about coding partly because of time spent playing on here.  It's sharp see?

Very addicting, play if you want to waste a ton of time

Also silly and funny. Probably one of the best idle games out there

Totally bonkers. Maybe the best idle/incremental game ever? I was actively playing this game for approximately 2 years before putting it down(and I hadn't even finished it!). If you're looking for a long term commitment that even a year into playing is introducing new mechanics this is for you. The screenshots in the store page don't even include everything. Truly insane.
I put NGU Idle in the second spot for best idle game ever, just after the legendary game that started them all, Anti-Idle.

Playing for second time, on Steam this time. Played it many years ago, not on Steam, but can't remember where. I don't think I finished it last time. Can't remember why, but possibly due to personal time management.
6 years later.. finally got the last achievement.. i may not have been playing optimally

The memest of them all!!! :D

10000000 AP /10, would recommend if you are willing to jump down the rabbit hole and you hate your life :D

It is absolute [b]disgrace[/b] that I have sank so many hours into this. This is like cookie clicker on steroids. I don't even know why but somehow this game is perfectly engineered to be the most addicting piece of clicker software. I kept running it as a background service on my laptop to squeeze levels. Go away. Leave the store page. Save yourself.
Downloaded the game yesterday. Played for 2 hours was boring on the third hour i got addicted and i have 21 hours from one day
this game should be banned. you will never stop playing. seriously, don't play.
Great game, played it for far too many hours. Think I got my monies worth tho?
funky game. hugly charming interface

Yeah sure, it has an audience. I've left the audience, for now.

8/10
its very nice. good idle.  very good with the kitty.
I personally dont believe it to be perfect, but its definitely pretty good. A shame the developer quit and stopped updating the sequel, would've been really fun.
Definitely the best idle game. Lots to do and optimize. Absolutely weird humor‚Äîlove it! Easy to learn, hard to master :D
absolutely as good as cookie clicke andfree so try it
My life force is being sucked out rapidly as a play this game
so much more soul in an exel spreadsheet compared to the new cod
how do i stop playing? its taking every free second of my life even tho its an idle game
There are a few giant moles you'll get to beat up so I'd say it's worth it
fun game. me like number get big
Fun game, I'm not even that deep yet and I'm hooked ;).
Is game. Is idle. Is good.
Overtook my life, do recommend.
I like the idling part of the game.
This game has the snarky dev
Pretty fun idler.
Very addictive game, I like it
fun little idle game
Make badly drawn kitty happy !
Gold Star. +100 internet points
way too addictive
yea its fun
fun
Is fun
Numbers go up
It's ok I guess.
goo
üëç
It's ok
Number Go Up
NGL Idle.
GOOD GAME
immaculate
YEP
dasdsadsdad
m

I've done it, I've finally 100% the game, It took me THREE YEARS...
The journey is now over, 2 years, 10 month, 18 days & 15 hours to beat everything the game have to offer.
Definitivly up there in the Idle game genre. 

I tryed it 5 years ago on kongregate and let it slide but when it came to steam and 1.0 released I knew I needed to give the game another chance, and since then I've been grinding and playing every single day for 3 years and have now finished the game.

The story is not 10/10, 
The gameplay is not 10/10.
The menu are not 10/10.
But somehow this game become a 10/10 cause it have such longevity and grow on you without you noticing, the more you play the more you uncover and slowly but surely you get grip in the game and get attatch to his world.

I think it's the best idle game I ever played and I play about 300 of them, most of them for days or month, heck I even finish clicker hero... But this game is my top idle game, I hope in my lifetime another game will make me want to play for 3 years without (much) interuption again.

Thanks 4G for this game.

Typical idler game, that doesn't take itself too seriously. Look at the text that explains things, look at the artwork.

It's clearly just a goofy idle game.

Surprisingly, it's one of the better idler games, with clear progression and a neat way to see your progression come to fruition. I'm only like 245 hours in, and it's not like I'm not having any fun, it's just I'm out of my idler phase at the moment. But if I had to come back to an idler, it'd be this one first and on top of the list.
Absolute peak idle game, its hard to get into cause there are a ton of mechanics, but dang it the game scratch the idle itch

Don't do this to yourself. 10/10 idle game.  The game does not respect your time and the only reason you would play it is because you have no respect for yours.
That being said, If you have a fixation on numbers going up, this game... has that.

Ive got nearly 1000 hours on this game and I am still nowhere near even unlocking the second difficulty, however, the experience I have had so far has been extremely fun and satisfying.
NGU idle is a simple idler, nothing too special other than some new and unique mechanics and fun battles. But its main appeal is its artstyle which is like no other. The art in NGU idle is very primitave and childish, and the humor is quite crude and funny. Its definetly a long grind and will be one of the completions i will take the most pride in, but I literally have no idea when or how I could possibly finish everything required.
Number goes up, addicting and cant stop, please send help

lol played for 100+ not actively. maybe a few. I dont know what it is about this idler but something is done correct for engagement. Its not fun or unfun it just works and there is either no review or a good review in my opion. there is nothing special about this game but it is a special game.

Hands down THE BEST IDLE EVER!  The more you play it just gets better, from bosses names to item names to the bloody troll challenge, real offline progression, no adds, no forcing you to buy in game currency which you get in game by playing AND its free!
At the start it might seem boring, maybe a little confusing but i promise you it just gets better and better!
The developer is the funniest F@C# with so much little detail it blows over most peoples heads but every little thing just makes it so funny but also rewarding, it makes the grind not really a grind, its so satisfying but makes you crazy at the same time!
If you like idles THIS IS IT! This will be your addiction!

Amazing little number expanding idle RPG. Love the level of silliness and also detail to it. Plenty to do OR just leave it running. Just realised if you level an item to 69 it says "lol" after.
Breathtaking.
its a lovely game it gives happy chemical to you and its just numbers
its fun, like adventure capitalist except as an rpg lots of content.

Sadly it has been abandoned, but the game itself is SO SO SO deep. There are so many things to do and even after this many hours I am nowhere near close to finishing. Its actually incredible. I have finished with the 'story' but theres a lot more content after that. I high recommend this if you enjoy other idle games. Its an absolute classic for me.
Game is decent. I feel like I have barely scratched the surface but it has been okay so far.

I am nearly 500 hours in and I can't get enough! This game rewards both patience and active, clever play. There is just so much depth, but it is not needlessly overcomplicated. I enjoy that you can go at whatever pace you're comfortable with, whether you let the game idle in the background (as the name would suggest) or you actively micromanage the game. The sense of progression and unlocking the next mechanics gives me such a dopamine rush. Even the challenges, which reset your NUMBER back to 1, never make me feel like I am losing actual progress.

There is just so much to this game, so do not expect to complete it in an evening or even a week. This is going to take you at least several months. After the nearly 500 hours I've put into this game, I'm just still scratching the surface of the content within. This game can easily provide hundreds, dare I say thousands of hours of entertainment. I can easily recommend it!

Still one of the best idle games available.  

The systems are varied and interesting.  

Art style is one of the styles of all time.

I probably put 4Gs cats through cat school (You do not need to buy MTX)

Really smoothly animated bars and bar related animations.

Still don't have Hacks and Wishes unlocked, this isn't Gnorp Apologue... it'll take months or years to work through all of the system.

?
Good, I only have a little time into it though. Wonder what the end game is like.
Very addictive, I run it at work behind my spreadsheets just to level stuph!
Addicting and incredibly deep. Lovely game to either micromanage actively or let ride idle. Super fun too.

I honestly am unaware of/confused by a handful of functions in the game myself, but it doesn't impact the gameplay nor how enjoyable it is. 10/10, five golden stars, I am autistic and foaming at the mouth for this game. Loving this so far, it's got a lot that certain something.  Seriously liking it, learning a bit more of and about coding partly because of time spent playing on here.  It's sharp see?

Very addicting, play if you want to waste a ton of time

Also silly and funny. Probably one of the best idle games out there

Totally bonkers. Maybe the best idle/incremental game ever? I was actively playing this game for approximately 2 years before putting it down(and I hadn't even finished it!). If you're looking for a long term commitment that even a year into playing is introducing new mechanics this is for you. The screenshots in the store page don't even include everything. Truly insane.
its long, addictive, and if you actually play it right (putting energy into the right things) you will make much more progress than anything that i could do within the time that i had
Good idle game with smooth and engaging progression. The story and several mechanics provide funny satire on idle games and sci-fi/pop culture along the way.

it's the best idle game to ever exist. this is my second playthrough as i was pre-sad before and neglected moving forward. currently moving back into evil and can't wait to get to the parts of the game i never did before.

If you love watching numbers go up and getting a dopamine rush from literally everything upgrading, NGU Idle is your new obsession. üìàüí•
This game has it all: 300+ hand-drawn bosses (yes, a flock of Canada Geese counts), 350+ wacky items, upgrades for your upgrades, and a story so absurd it somehow works. You can play actively or just sit back and let your numbers climb while sipping coffee. ‚òï‚ú®
The humor is ridiculous, the dev is delightfully snarky, and the progress bars never stop giving that sweet, sweet sense of achievement. Also, there‚Äôs a badly drawn kitty somewhere, because why not. üê±
Basically: NGU Idle is chaos, math, and madness all rolled into one. 10/10, my brain hurts but the numbers look amazing.

Honestly, I rarely comment on a game. 

4G, Sir, you have done an amazing job with this game. Although I may have not listened to you, this Game is funny and fun as hell. BY FAR the best idle game i have ever played

100/10 review

This game is great, but if you prefer shorter games, you probably won't like this one. I started playing NGU about 3 and a half years ago (I did forget about it for a bit and got like a year of offline gains though), but I still have a lot of content left to unlock. I've reached boss 150 in normal mode, out of 301 bosses and 3 difficulties, defeated 6 of the 19 titans, and only have 14 out of 19 main features to unlock. I've played a lot of idle games, and one of the things that I dislike about other idlers is the lack of new content. The game itself is good, but I get bored of just doing the same thing over and over, but NGU doesn't have that problem. As I mentioned earlier, there are 19 different main features to help you get stronger and fight more bosses, and lots of different things for each feature. Overall I recommend this to anyone who is looking for a long-term idle game to play.
I wanted a game where the numbers went up. I can confirm, the numbers went up.
Great game that has kept me interested and wanting more every second.

Ok, if I have one and only one comment about this game, it's that NOBODY can call 4G a liar.

There are a LOT of numbers. And almost EVERY single one of them goes up A LOT.

10/10 I feel like I'm accomplishing something in the background while I work.
Absolutely loved playing this game as a kid and am happy to see/play this game again after so long

I have been playing this game for a few years over different accounts, and I have barely scratched the surface of this game. The stats and numbers are so addicting, and I really enjoy the artwork and story(?). I hope to one day beat this game.

negative.review:
boring for modern gaming
and I LOVE LOVE watching numbers go up but this offers not much

Auto merge items doesn't work, an idle game without non functioning upgrades especially ones that are supposed to make the game not a horrible tedious slog should actually function how does this not work after so long. And yes I ticked the box in the inventory that says auto merge items it does not work
no

So, I really feel like any positivity towards this game is entirely comprised of either Nostalgia, or simple Stockholm Syndrome.

Doing anything in this game is an extreme grind. Basic automation features are locked behind somewhere between hundreds and thousands of hours of playtime, or a paywall (or a cheatwall). I thought Trimps was bad for having its automation a hundred hours in, but I'm pretty sure this is an order of magnitude above that.
It's a game targeted towards completionists who just want to see numbers *very slowly* reach 100, and... sure. You do you.

The entire thing is written in that awful 2000s-style lol-so-random meme internet humor where nothing can be serious, and nothing can be cohesive. You'll be fighting zombies, sentient cheese, the kitchen sink, and giant moles. Every line of story is a joke trying to one-up the last one with sheer nonsequiter. So unlike other long incrementals (like Trimps) that have some creative consistency in their world's absurdity, there isn't even the incentive of story to keep playing to see what's next, by hook or by crook.

boring for modern gaming
and I LOVE LOVE watching numbers go up but this offers not much

Overall I don't recommend this game. This game is mostly a great game, but it's not a game for me. It may or may not be a great game for you.

I get anxiety from feeling like I'm missing out if I don't min-max my time optimally. I love how complex this game is, but I think about it too much while the game isn't actively running. This is probably an issue I have with the genre more than this game.
I enjoyed the game until i closed it. i went to play after work and when I opened it, the screen was 100x zoomed in and i cant fix it.

Auto merge items doesn't work, an idle game without non functioning upgrades especially ones that are supposed to make the game not a horrible tedious slog should actually function how does this not work after so long. And yes I ticked the box in the inventory that says auto merge items it does not work

Just another trash game.
Just boring.
Less than most mobile games.
I think its overrated. i get it that its one of the ogs ones but its just not good enough, i dont like it
Cool game, but has in app purchases.
no

So, I really feel like any positivity towards this game is entirely comprised of either Nostalgia, or simple Stockholm Syndrome.

Doing anything in this game is an extreme grind. Basic automation features are locked behind somewhere between hundreds and thousands of hours of playtime, or a paywall (or a cheatwall). I thought Trimps was bad for having its automation a hundred hours in, but I'm pretty sure this is an order of magnitude above that.
It's a game targeted towards completionists who just want to see numbers *very slowly* reach 100, and... sure. You do you.

The entire thing is written in that awful 2000s-style lol-so-random meme internet humor where nothing can be serious, and nothing can be cohesive. You'll be fighting zombies, sentient cheese, the kitchen sink, and giant moles. Every line of story is a joke trying to one-up the last one with sheer nonsequiter. So unlike other long incrementals (like Trimps) that have some creative consistency in their world's absurdity, there isn't even the incentive of story to keep playing to see what's next, by hook or by crook.

boring for modern gaming
and I LOVE LOVE watching numbers go up but this offers not much

Overall I don't recommend this game. This game is mostly a great game, but it's not a game for me. It may or may not be a great game for you.

I get anxiety from feeling like I'm missing out if I don't min-max my time optimally. I love how complex this game is, but I think about it too much while the game isn't actively running. This is probably an issue I have with the genre more than this game.
I enjoyed the game until i closed it. i went to play after work and when I opened it, the screen was 100x zoomed in and i cant fix it.

Auto merge items doesn't work, an idle game without non functioning upgrades especially ones that are supposed to make the game not a horrible tedious slog should actually function how does this not work after so long. And yes I ticked the box in the inventory that says auto merge items it does not work

Just another trash game.
Just boring.
Less than most mobile games.
I think its overrated. i get it that its one of the ogs ones but its just not good enough, i dont like it
Cool game, but has in app purchases.
